### eliminateFrameIndicesBackwards() {#afea420c0f4efe47ef107c32396cf8b05}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::X86RegisterInfo::eliminateFrameIndicesBackwards () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process">Process</a> frame indices in forwards block order because <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86instrinfo/#ab6432ebba31ce9e456ad54b2b277d678">X86InstrInfo::getSPAdjust</a> relies on it when searching for the ADJCALLSTACKUP pseudo following a call.

TODO: Fix this and return true like all other targets.

</MemberDefinition>

### findDeadCallerSavedReg() {#a48595fc4feb49d51ed2eecbf73dadc24}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned X86RegisterInfo::findDeadCallerSavedReg (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> &amp; MBBI) const</>}>
findDeadCallerSavedReg - Return a caller-saved register that isn&#39;t live when it reaches the &quot;return&quot; instruction.

We can then pop a stack object to this register without worry about clobbering it.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86registerinfo-h/#l00158">158</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86registerinfo-h">X86RegisterInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86registerinfo-cpp/#l00984">984</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86registerinfo-cpp">X86RegisterInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getFramePtr() {#ac117c05656fb2c5fb08b1df3a4af2fe8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="Register llvm::X86RegisterInfo::getFramePtr () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns physical register used as frame pointer.

This will always returns the frame pointer register, contrary to <a href="#a45e0af6fcebf5fd5a4584974e13c6810">getFrameRegister()</a> which returns the &quot;base pointer&quot; in situations involving a stack, frame and base pointer.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86registerinfo-h/#l00171">171</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86registerinfo-h">X86RegisterInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Private Member Attributes

### BasePtr {#ac77b2b9a3ab9bbcbebbcca21109fac95}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::X86RegisterInfo::BasePtr">
BasePtr - <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> physical register used as a base ptr in complex stack frames.

I.e., when we need a 3rd base, not just SP and FP, due to variable size stack objects.
